solution_line_template: Under optimal wind conditions, if her ship sails {duration_one_sail} hours with 1 sail, she will travel {duration_one_sail}*{speed_one_sail}=<<{duration_one_sail}*{speed_one_sail}={distance_one_sail}>>{distance_one_sail} nautical miles.

Under optimal wind conditions, if her ship sails {duration_two_sails} hours with 2 sails, she will travel {duration_two_sails}*{speed_two_sails}=<<{duration_two_sails}*{speed_two_sails}={distance_two_sails}>>{distance_two_sails} nautical miles.
In total, she will travel {distance_one_sail}+{distance_two_sails}=<<{distance_one_sail}+{distance_two_sails}={total_nautical_miles}>>{total_nautical_miles} nautical miles.

If 1 nautical mile is equivalent to {nautical_to_land_mile_conversion} land miles, then Buffy will travel {total_nautical_miles}*{nautical_to_land_mile_conversion}=<<{total_nautical_miles}*{nautical_to_land_mile_conversion}={total_land_miles}>>{total_land_miles} land miles.
